title._content: ["Claverack," Colonel Thomas Henry Barber house, Halsey Neck Lane, Southampton, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Claverack," Colonel Thomas Henry Barber house, Halsey Neck Lane, Southampton, New York. Rustic gate] [ca. 1915] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Robert Henderson Robertson, built 1892. Landscape: F. L. Olmsted and Co., 1893-1894. Associated Name: Harriet Townsend (Mrs. Thomas H.) Barber. Other: In lectures and consistent with press at the time, Frances Benjamin Johnston credited Claverack as a garden by Frederick Law Olmsted in her slide collection.Today: House, now known as "Keewardin," is restored with a new garden. On slide (handwritten): "B" and "Barber, Mrs. T.H." Also, no. "3717." Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in: Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York : Acanthus Press, 2012. Figure 34c. Subjects: Gardens--New York (State)--Southampton--1910-1920. Gates--New York (State)--Southampton--1910-1920. Format: Lantern slides--Hand colored--1910-1920. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16231 Call Number: LC-J717-X100- 22
